title.value: DASFormer: Self-Supervised Pretraining for Earthquake Monitoring
title.justification: The title accurately reflects the topic and core contribution of the paper, which introduces DASFormer for earthquake monitoring using self-supervised pretraining.
title.quote: DASFormer: Self-Supervised Pretraining for Earthquake Monitoring

extractions.description: This paper introduces DASFormer, a novel self-supervised pretraining technique for earthquake monitoring using Distributed Acoustic Sensing (DAS) data. The model leverages a coarse-to-fine framework to capture spatial and temporal patterns in DAS data, demonstrating superior performance in unsupervised P/S phase detection and potential for other downstream tasks.

type.justification: The paper conducts experiments to validate the effectiveness of the DASFormer model in earthquake monitoring tasks, specifically focusing on unsupervised P/S phase detection and other downstream applications.
type.quote: Experimental results demonstrate that DASFormer is effective in terms of several evaluation metrics and outperforms state-of-the-art time-series forecasting, anomaly detection, and foundation models on the unsupervised seismic detection task.

name.justification: The primary application of the research is in the field of earthquake monitoring, employing DAS technology for improved seismic detection.
name.quote: Earthquake monitoring is a fundamental task to unravel the underlying physics of earthquakes and mitigate associated hazards for public safety.

name.justification: The paper deals extensively with time series forecasting and anomaly detection techniques applied to DAS data.
name.quote: We demonstrate that the well-pretrained DASFormer can be served as a time series detector for earthquake monitoring.

name.justification: One of the main tasks for the proposed model is anomaly detection in seismic data.
name.quote: The P/S-phase detection task is a primary task in earthquake monitoring, which can be viewed as an anomaly detection problem.

name.justification: DASFormer is the primary model proposed and evaluated in this paper, specifically designed for earthquake monitoring using DAS data.
name.quote: In this paper, we present DASFormer, a novel self-supervised pretraining technique on DAS data with a coarse-to-fine framework that models spatial-temporal signal correlation.

is_contributed.justification: DASFormer is the main contribution of this paper.
is_contributed.quote: In this paper, we present DASFormer, a novel self-supervised pretraining technique on DAS data with a coarse-to-fine framework that models spatial-temporal signal correlation.

is_executed.justification: The experimental results were obtained by executing the DASFormer model.
is_executed.quote: Experimental results demonstrate that DASFormer is effective in terms of several evaluation metrics and outperforms state-of-the-art time-series forecasting, anomaly detection, and foundation models on the unsupervised seismic detection task.

is_compared.justification: The performance of DASFormer is compared against multiple state-of-the-art models.
is_compared.quote: Experimental results demonstrate that DASFormer is effective in terms of several evaluation metrics and outperforms state-of-the-art time-series forecasting, anomaly detection, and foundation models on the unsupervised seismic detection task.

referenced_paper_title.justification: DASFormer is introduced and explained within this paper, thus no separate reference paper is provided for this model.

name.justification: This dataset was used to train and evaluate the DASFormer model in the experiments.
name.quote: We conduct experiments using DAS data collected by Caltech in Ridgecrest city, California Li et al. (2021a).

referenced_paper_title.value: Rapid response to the 2019 ridgecrest earthquake with distributed acoustic sensing.
referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset is referred to in the context of the Ridgecrest earthquake study by Li et al. (2021a).
referenced_paper_title.quote: We conduct experiments using DAS data collected by Caltech in Ridgecrest city, California Li et al. (2021a).

name.justification: The network's data was used in conjunction with the Ridgecrest DAS data for comprehensive seismic monitoring.
name.quote: 90 earthquake events into training/validation/testing sets alongside the timeline with 45/20/25 events, respectively.

referenced_paper_title.value: Southern california earthquake center. Caltech. Dataset
referenced_paper_title.justification: The data related to the Southern California Seismic Network is referenced to this paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: 90 earthquake events into training/validation/testing sets alongside the timeline with 45/20/25 events, respectively.

name.justification: The model and experiments were implemented using the PyTorch library.
name.quote: The model is implemented using PyTorch Paszke et al. (2019).

referenced_paper_title.value: PyTorch: An imperative style, high-performance deep learning library.
referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference to the library usage points to the original PyTorch paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The model is implemented using PyTorch Paszke et al. (2019).
